intro: Andryala maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Andryala maroccana is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
